com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats

Class Accumulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats.BaseAccumulator
        • com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats.Accumulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConfigurable, IRegisterable, IAccumulator, IStats

    public class Accumulator
extends BaseAccumulator
implements IAccumulator, IStats
    Simple implementation of IAccumulator.

    This implementation supports via properties:

    • numberOfMessagesIgnoredAtStartup - see BaseAccumulator.setNumIgnoredAtStartup(int). Default 0
    • maxBufferedPoints - see getMaxBufferedPoints(). Default 20.
    • numIntervals - see getNumIntervals(). Default 500.
    • numStartUpSamplePoints - see getNumStartUpSamplePoints(). Default 100.
    • expansion - Defines how much we should extend the range beyond the sampled minimum and maximum. Default 0.1.
    • name - A name which will also be printed in the log to determine which Accumulator this output came from.

    Typical usage:
    IAccumulator accumulator = new Accumulator(maxBufferedPoints, numIntervals, expectedMin, expectedMax); : while (true) { long startTime = System.nanoTime(); : //Perform some processing : long elapsedTime = System.nanoTime() - startTime; accumulator.accumulate(n++, elapsedTime); } : //Query accumulator for analysis of timings. DataPoint min = accumulator.getMin(); DataPoint max = accumulator.getMax(); long avg = accumulator.getAverage(); System.out.println("Min value " + min + " Max value " + max + " Avg " + avg); DataPoint[] lastDataPoints = accumulator.getBufferedDataPoints(); System.out.println("Last data"); for (int i = 0; i < lastDataPoints.length; i++) { System.out.println(lastDataPoints[i]); } IntervalCount[] distribution = accumulator.getCounts(); System.out.println("Counts"); for (int i = 0; i < distribution.length; i++) { System.out.println(distribution[i]); }

    Author:
    John Cameron

    • Constructor Detail

      • Accumulator

        public Accumulator()

      • Accumulator

        public Accumulator(int maxBufferedPoints,
                   int numIntervals,
                   long expectedMin,
                   long expectedMax)
        Create an accumulator which will store up to the number of data points specified by maxBufferedPoints and will accumulate counts for values in numIntervals ranges between expectedMin and expectedMax.
        Parameters:
        maxBufferedPoints - Maximum number of saved data points.
        numIntervals - Number of intervals in the value count distribution.
        expectedMin - Minimum value for which we will accumulate counts.
        expectedMax - Maximum value for which we will accumulate counts.

      • Accumulator

        public Accumulator(int maxBufferedPoints,
                   int numIntervals,
                   int numStartUpSamplePoints,
                   double expansion)
        Create an accumulator which will store up to the number of data points specified by maxBufferedPoints and will accumulate counts for values in numIntervals ranges.

        The accumulator will examine the first numStartUpSamplePoints and compute the maximum and minimum values. The range of values for which we will accumulate counts is calculated as: 

           min - (max-min)*expansion to max + (max-min)*expansion
        Parameters:
        maxBufferedPoints - Maximum number of saved data points.
        numIntervals - Number of intervals in the value count distribution.
        numStartUpSamplePoints - Number of points sampled to determine the expected range of values.
        expansion - Defines how much we should extend the range beyond the sampled minimum and maximum.

        public Accumulator(Properties props)

      • accumulate

        public void accumulate(long id,
                       long val)
        Accumulates the given data point (id and value).
        Specified by:
        accumulate in interface IAccumulator
        Parameters:
        id - ID, if any, associated with the value. Just pass 0 or some other special value if there is no id.
        val - Value to be accumulated. For displaying purposes this class assumes val represents elapsed nanoseconds, obtained by subtracting an older timestamp from System.nanoTime()

      • getAverage

        public long getAverage()
        Description copied from interface: IStats
        Return the current average value.

        This is an optional operation. Concrete implementations may choose whether or not to support based on their specific characteristics.

        Use the IStats.hasAverage() method to determine whether to expect a meaningful return from this method.

        Specified by:
        getAverage in interface IStats
        Returns:
        Average value. If the implementation does not support the concept of average value then this value is undefined.
        See Also:
        IStats.hasAverage()
